sap.rules.ui.DecisionTableCellFormat.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.52.8 use the property decisionTableFormat.
An enumeration that defines how a cell in a decision table is formulated by the rule creator.

Guided.!description: Specifies that the content of the decision table cell is restricted to values relevant to the data type of the table column's expression.

Text.!description: Specifies that the content of the decision table cell receives all possible suggestions (relevant functions, attributes and values) that are relevant to the data type of the table column's expression.

Both.!description: Specifies that both rule formats are available in the decision table; allowing the rule creator to choose whether to formulate the decision table cells in either the basic or advanced format.

extend.!description: Creates a new subclass of class sap.rules.ui.services.ExpressionLanguage with name sClassName and enriches it with the information contained in oClassInfo. oClassInfo might contain the same kind of information as described in {@link sap.ui.core.Element.extend}.
extend.!type: fn(sClassName: String, oClassInfo?: Object, FNMetaImpl?: fn()) -> fn()

parameters.oClassInfo: type: object, description: Object literal with information about the class
parameters.FNMetaImpl: type: function, description: Constructor function for the metadata object; if not given, it defaults to the metadata implementation used by this class
parameters.sClassName: type: string, description: Name of the class being created

enableElseIf.!description: The value determines whether the Else If section is displayed in a Text Rule when the control is used with S/4 HANA 17.05 (Cloud) or 17.09 (On Premise) and higher (On Premise).

enableSettings.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.120.2 to configure the settings, use the Manage Rules Project app or the Rule Authoring APIs.
The value determines whether the Settings button is displayed in a Text Rule when the control is used with S/4 HANA 17.05 (Cloud) or 17.09 (On Premise) and higher (On Premise).

enableSettingResult.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.120.2 to configure the settings, use the Manage Rules Project app or the Rule Authoring APIs.
undefined

bindingContextPath.!description: Path to a Rule object in the model data, which is used for the definition of relative context bindings inside the RuleBuilder control (mandatory). Example: "/Rules(Id='0050569181751ED683EFEEC6AA2B73C5',Version='000001')"

busyIndicatorSize.!description: The size of the BusyIndicator. For controls with a width smaller 3rem a sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Small should be used. If the size could vary in width and the width could get smaller than 3rem, the sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Auto option could be used. The default is set to sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Medium For a full screen BusyIndicator use sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Large.

threshold.!description: The threshold defines how many additional (not yet visible records) shall be pre-fetched to enable smooth scrolling. The threshold is always added to the visibleRowCount. If the visibleRowCount is 10 and the threshold is 100, there will be 110 records fetched with the initial load.

enableElse.!description: The value determines whether the Else section is displayed in a Text Rule when the control is used with S/4 HANA 17.05 (Cloud) or 17.09 (On Premise) and higher (On Premise).

decisionTableFormat.!description: The value determines whether the user can set the rendering of the decision Table to be based on cellFormat or rule Format

blocked.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.69 The blocked property is deprecated. There is no accessibility support for this property. Blocked controls should not be used inside Controls, which rely on keyboard navigation, e.g. List controls.
Whether the control is currently in blocked state.

busyIndicatorDelay.!description: The delay in milliseconds, after which the busy indicator will show up for this control.

busy.!description: Whether the control is currently in busy state.

fieldGroupIds.!description: The IDs of a logical field group that this control belongs to. All fields in a logical field group should share the same fieldGroupId. Once a logical field group is left, the validateFieldGroup event is fired. For backward compatibility with older releases, field group IDs are syntactically not limited, but it is suggested to use only valid {@link sap.ui.core.ID}s. See {@link #attachValidateFieldGroup} or consult the {@link topic:5b0775397e394b1fb973fa207554003e Field Group} documentation.

types.!description: Available types that can be created using the sap.rules.ui.RuleBuilder control. If empty, all rule types will be available for selection. If only one type exists, the Rule Builder will open it automatically.

visibleRowCount.!description: Number of visible rows of the table.

visible.!description: Whether the control should be visible on the screen. If set to false, a placeholder will be rendered to mark the location of the invisible control in the DOM of the current page. The placeholder will be hidden and have zero dimensions (display: none). Also see {@link module:sap/ui/core/InvisibleRenderer InvisibleRenderer}.

editable.!description: Indicates whether or not the controls of the RuleBuilder are editable.

cellFormat.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.52.8 use the decisionTableFormat property.
The value determines the user input mode for the corresponding rule cells when creating or editing a rule.

hitPolicies.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.120.2 to configure the settings, use the Manage Rules Project app or the Rule Authoring APIs.
The value determines how the results of the decision table are evaluated when more than one rule is matched for a given set of inputs.

extend.!description: Creates a new subclass of class sap.rules.ui.TextRuleConfiguration with name sClassName and enriches it with the information contained in oClassInfo. oClassInfo might contain the same kind of information as described in {@link sap.ui.core.Element.extend}.
extend.!type: fn(sClassName: String, oClassInfo?: Object, FNMetaImpl?: fn()) -> fn()

parameters.oClassInfo: type: object, description: Object literal with information about the class
parameters.FNMetaImpl: type: function, description: Constructor function for the metadata object; if not given, it defaults to the metadata implementation used by this class
parameters.sClassName: type: string, description: Name of the class being created

sap.rules.ui.services.ExpressionLanguage.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.120.2 use the attribute astExpressionLanguage instead.
Provides the ExpressionLanguage service functionality, such as expression validations, expression parsing, auto-complete suggestions, retrieving expression metadata and tokens, and performing runtime services (fetching data objects, outputs, etc).

getMetadata.!description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.rules.ui.services.ExpressionLanguage.

setBindingContextPath.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getBindingContextPath bindingContextPath}. Path to a Vocabulary object in the model data, which is used for the definition of relative context bindings inside the Expression Language control (mandatory). Example: "/Vocabularies(Id='0050569181751ED683EFEEC6AA2B73C5')" When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

parameters.sBindingContextPath: type: string, description: New value for property bindingContextPath

setData.!description: Sets the expression language data (vocabulary and metadata).

parameters.oData: type: object, description: Contains the language data

getBindingContextPath.!description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getBindingContextPath bindingContextPath}.

Path to a Vocabulary object in the model data, which is used for the definition of relative context bindings inside the Expression Language control (mandatory). Example: "/Vocabularies(Id='0050569181751ED683EFEEC6AA2B73C5')"

extend.!description: Creates a new subclass of class sap.rules.ui.services.ExpressionLanguage with name sClassName and enriches it with the information contained in oClassInfo. oClassInfo might contain the same kind of information as described in {@link sap.ui.core.Element.extend}.
extend.!type: fn(sClassName: String, oClassInfo?: Object, FNMetaImpl?: fn()) -> fn()

parameters.oClassInfo: type: object, description: Object literal with information about the class
parameters.FNMetaImpl: type: function, description: Constructor function for the metadata object; if not given, it defaults to the metadata implementation used by this class
parameters.sClassName: type: string, description: Name of the class being created

detachDataChange.!description: Detaches event handler fnFunction from the {@link #event:dataChange dataChange} event of this sap.rules.ui.services.ExpressionLanguage. The passed function and listener object must match the ones used for event registration.
detachDataChange.!type: fn(fnFunction: function(sap.ui.base.Event) : void, oListener?: Object) -> sap.rules.ui.services.ExpressionLanguage

parameters.oListener: type: object, description: Context object on which the given function had to be called
parameters.fnFunction: type: function(sap.ui.base.Event) : void, description: The function to be called, when the event occurs

getExpressionMetadata.!description: Separates the expression into individual tokens.

parameters.sExpression: type: string, description: The expression that has to be tokenized.

getSuggestions.!description: Provides a context-sensitive suggestion list that assists the business user with the completion of the input of an expression using the rule expression language.
getSuggestions.!type: fn(sExpression?: String, eType?: sap.rules.ui.ExpressionType, bCollection?: Boolean, bToken?: Boolean) -> Object

parameters.sExpression: type: string, description: The rule expression to be completed.
parameters.bCollection: type: boolean, description: Indicates whether the final expression is a collection.
parameters.eType: type: sap.rules.ui.ExpressionType, description: The expected business data type of the expression.
parameters.bToken: type: boolean, description: Indicates whether to return tokenizing sementics.

sap.rules.ui.services.ExpressionLanguage.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new ExpressionLanguage element. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getValueHelpCallback valueHelpCallback} : any
    • {@link #getBindingContextPath bindingContextPath} : string
  • Events
    • {@link #event:dataChange dataChange} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Element#constructor sap.ui.core.Element} can be used as well.

fireDataChange.!description: Fires event {@link #event:dataChange dataChange} to attached listeners.

parameters.mParameters: type: object, description: Parameters to pass along with the event

sap.rules.ui.services.ExpressionLanguage.!helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.120.2 use the attribute astExpressionLanguage instead.
Provides the ExpressionLanguage service functionality, such as expression validations, expression parsing, auto-complete suggestions, retrieving expression metadata and tokens, and performing runtime services (fetching data objects, outputs, etc).

getValueHelpCallback.!description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getValueHelpCallback valueHelpCallback}.

The valueHelpCallback is a function that receives by reference an array of value help metadata and adds to each item an OData model instance. The OData model is used for suggesting allowed values and for validating values that are used in the rule.

setValueHelpCallback.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getValueHelpCallback valueHelpCallback}. The valueHelpCallback is a function that receives by reference an array of value help metadata and adds to each item an OData model instance. The OData model is used for suggesting allowed values and for validating values that are used in the rule. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

parameters.oValueHelpCallback: type: any, description: New value for property valueHelpCallback

validateExpression.!description: Validates a given rule expression according to a specific business data type.
validateExpression.!type: fn(sExpression?: String, eType?: sap.rules.ui.ExpressionType, bCollection?: Boolean, bToken?: Boolean) -> Object

parameters.sExpression: type: string, description: The expression to be validated.
parameters.bCollection: type: boolean, description: Indicates whether the expression is a collection.
parameters.eType: type: sap.rules.ui.ExpressionType, description: The expected data type of the expression.
parameters.bToken: type: boolean, description: Indicates whether to return tokenizing semantics.

attachDataChange.!description: Attaches event handler fnFunction to the {@link #event:dataChange dataChange} event of this sap.rules.ui.services.ExpressionLanguage. When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.rules.ui.services.ExpressionLanguage itself.
attachDataChange.!type: fn(oData?: Object, fnFunction: function(sap.ui.base.Event) : void, oListener?: Object) -> sap.rules.ui.services.ExpressionLanguage

parameters.oListener: type: object, description: Context object to call the event handler with. Defaults to this sap.rules.ui.services.ExpressionLanguage itself
parameters.fnFunction: type: function(sap.ui.base.Event) : void, description: The function to be called when the event occurs
parameters.oData: type: object, description: An application-specific payload object that will be passed to the event handler along with the event object when firing the event

sap.rules.ui.DecisionTableFormat.!description: An enumeration that decides the rendering format for decisionTable.

CellFormat.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.52.8 use the attribute RuleFormat instead.
Specifies that the rendering of a cell is based on cellFormat and each cell can have a different format during rendering

RuleFormat.!description: Specifies that the rendering is at the rule level. The value set here is applicable for all the cells in the rule.

extend.!type: fn(sClassName: String, oClassInfo?: Object, FNMetaImpl?: fn()) -> fn()

bindingContextPath.!description: Path to a Vocabulary object in the model data, which is used for the definition of relative context bindings inside the Expression Language control (mandatory). Example: "/Vocabularies(Id='0050569181751ED683EFEEC6AA2B73C5')"

setTypes.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getTypes types}. Available types that can be created using the sap.rules.ui.RuleBuilder control. If empty, all rule types will be available for selection. If only one type exists, the Rule Builder will open it automatically. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is [DecisionTable, TextRule].

parameters.sTypes: type: sap.rules.ui.RuleType[], description: New value for property types

getExpressionLanguage.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.120.2 use the attribute astExpressionLanguage instead.
ID of the element which is the current target of the association {@link #getExpressionLanguage expressionLanguage}, or null.

setExpressionLanguage.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.120.2 use the attribute astExpressionLanguage instead.
Sets the associated {@link #getExpressionLanguage expressionLanguage}.

parameters.oExpressionLanguage: type: sap.ui.core.ID|sap.rules.ui.services.ExpressionLanguage, description: ID of an element which becomes the new target of this expressionLanguage association; alternatively, an element instance may be given

sap.rules.ui.RuleBuilder.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new RuleBuilder control. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getTypes types} : sap.rules.ui.RuleType[] (default: [DecisionTable, TextRule])
    • {@link #getBindingContextPath bindingContextPath} : string
    • {@link #getEditable editable} : boolean (default: true)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getDecisionTableConfiguration decisionTableConfiguration} : sap.rules.ui.DecisionTableConfiguration
    • {@link #getTextRuleConfiguration textRuleConfiguration} : sap.rules.ui.TextRuleConfiguration
  • Associations
    • {@link #getExpressionLanguage expressionLanguage} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.rules.ui.services.ExpressionLanguage)
    • {@link #getAstExpressionLanguage astExpressionLanguage} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.rules.ui.services.AstExpressionLanguage)
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

getTextRuleConfiguration.!description:
Gets content of aggregation {@link #getTextRuleConfiguration textRuleConfiguration}.

Configuration for rule of type 'Text Rule'.

setEditable.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getEditable editable}. Indicates whether or not the controls of the RuleBuilder are editable. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is true.

parameters.bEditable: type: boolean, description: New value for property editable

destroyTextRuleConfiguration.!description: Destroys the textRuleConfiguration in the aggregation {@link #getTextRuleConfiguration textRuleConfiguration}.

sap.rules.ui.RuleBuilder.!helpDescription: The sap.rules.ui.RuleBuilder control allows business users to create rules using a business language.

getAstExpressionLanguage.!description: ID of the element which is the current target of the association {@link #getAstExpressionLanguage astExpressionLanguage}, or null.

destroyDecisionTableConfiguration.!description: Destroys the decisionTableConfiguration in the aggregation {@link #getDecisionTableConfiguration decisionTableConfiguration}.

getTypes.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getTypes types}. Available types that can be created using the sap.rules.ui.RuleBuilder control. If empty, all rule types will be available for selection. If only one type exists, the Rule Builder will open it automatically. Default value is [DecisionTable, TextRule].

parameters.oTextRuleConfiguration: type: sap.rules.ui.TextRuleConfiguration, description: The textRuleConfiguration to set

parameters.oDecisionTableConfiguration: type: sap.rules.ui.DecisionTableConfiguration, description: The decisionTableConfiguration to set

sap.rules.ui.RuleType.!description: An enumeration that defines whether the rule is formulated as a table with multiple rules instead of a rule with a single associated condition.

DecisionTable.!description: Specifies that the rule is formulated as a table that allows complex rules to be visualized according to an if-then-else logic.

TextRule.!description: Specifies that the rule is formulated as a single condition, which is written directly in a business language.

Default value is true.

parameters.FNMetaImpl: type: function, description: Constructor function for the metadata object; if not given, it defaults to the metadata implementation used by this class
parameters.sClassName: type: string, description: Name of the class being created

sap.rules.ui.TextRuleConfiguration.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new TextRuleConfiguration. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getEnableSettings enableSettings} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getEnableSettingResult enableSettingResult} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getEnableElse enableElse} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getEnableElseIf enableElseIf} : boolean (default: true)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:change change} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Element#constructor sap.ui.core.Element} can be used as well.
sap.rules.ui.TextRuleConfiguration.!helpDescription: The sap.rules.ui.TextRuleConfiguration element provides the ability to define specific properties that will be applied when rendering the sap.rules.ui.RuleBuilder in decision table mode.

setEnableSettings.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.120.2 to configure the settings, use the Manage Rules Project app or the Rule Authoring APIs.
Sets a new value for property {@link #getEnableSettings enableSettings}. The value determines whether the Settings button is displayed in a Text Rule when the control is used with S/4 HANA 17.05 (Cloud) or 17.09 (On Premise) and higher (On Premise). When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is false.

parameters.bEnableSettings: type: boolean, description: New value for property enableSettings

extend.!description: Creates a new subclass of class sap.rules.ui.services.AstExpressionLanguage with name sClassName and enriches it with the information contained in oClassInfo. oClassInfo might contain the same kind of information as described in {@link sap.ui.core.Element.extend}.
extend.!type: fn(sClassName: String, oClassInfo?: Object, FNMetaImpl?: fn()) -> fn()

parameters.oClassInfo: type: object, description: Object literal with information about the class
parameters.FNMetaImpl: type: function, description: Constructor function for the metadata object; if not given, it defaults to the metadata implementation used by this class
parameters.sClassName: type: string, description: Name of the class being created

sap.rules.ui.RuleHitPolicy.!description: An enumeration that defines the output when more than one rule in the decision table is matched for a given set of inputs.

FirstMatch.!description: Specifies that only the first condition that matches the input (the first matching row by order in the decision table) is returned as an output.

AllMatch.!description: Specifies that all conditions that match the input (each matching row in the decision table) are returned as an output.

setDecisionTableFormat.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getDecisionTableFormat decisionTableFormat}. The value determines whether the user can set the rendering of the decision Table to be based on cellFormat or rule Format When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is RuleFormat.

parameters.sDecisionTableFormat: type: sap.rules.ui.DecisionTableFormat, description: New value for property decisionTableFormat

setEnableSettingResult.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.120.2 to configure the settings, use the Manage Rules Project app or the Rule Authoring APIs.
Sets a new value for property {@link #getEnableSettingResult enableSettingResult}. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is true.

parameters.bEnableSettingResult: type: boolean, description: New value for property enableSettingResult

setThreshold.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getThreshold threshold}. The threshold defines how many additional (not yet visible records) shall be pre-fetched to enable smooth scrolling. The threshold is always added to the visibleRowCount. If the visibleRowCount is 10 and the threshold is 100, there will be 110 records fetched with the initial load. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is 30.

parameters.iThreshold: type: int, description: New value for property threshold

setCellFormat.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.52.8 use the decisionTableFormat property.
Sets a new value for property {@link #getCellFormat cellFormat}. The value determines the user input mode for the corresponding rule cells when creating or editing a rule. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is Both.

parameters.sCellFormat: type: sap.rules.ui.DecisionTableCellFormat, description: New value for property cellFormat

detachChange.!description: Detaches event handler fnFunction from the {@link #event:change change} event of this sap.rules.ui.DecisionTableConfiguration. The passed function and listener object must match the ones used for event registration.
detachChange.!type: fn(fnFunction: function(sap.ui.base.Event) : void, oListener?: Object) -> sap.rules.ui.DecisionTableConfiguration

parameters.oListener: type: object, description: Context object on which the given function had to be called
parameters.fnFunction: type: function(sap.ui.base.Event) : void, description: The function to be called, when the event occurs

sap.rules.ui.DecisionTableConfiguration.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new DecisionTableConfiguration. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getCellFormat cellFormat} : sap.rules.ui.DecisionTableCellFormat (default: Both)
    • {@link #getHitPolicies hitPolicies} : sap.rules.ui.RuleHitPolicy[] (default: [FirstMatch, AllMatch])
    • {@link #getEnableSettings enableSettings} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getEnableSettingResult enableSettingResult} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getDecisionTableFormat decisionTableFormat} : sap.rules.ui.DecisionTableFormat (default: RuleFormat)
    • {@link #getThreshold threshold} : int (default: 30)
    • {@link #getVisibleRowCount visibleRowCount} : int (default: 30)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:change change} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Element#constructor sap.ui.core.Element} can be used as well.

getVisibleRowCount.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getVisibleRowCount visibleRowCount}. Number of visible rows of the table. Default value is 30.

setEnableSettings.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.120.2 to configure the settings, use the Manage Rules Project app or the Rule Authoring APIs.
Sets a new value for property {@link #getEnableSettings enableSettings}. The value determines whether the Settings button is displayed in a decision table when the control is used with S/4 HANA 17.05 (Cloud) or 17.09 (On Premise) and higher (On Premise). When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is false.

parameters.bEnableSettings: type: boolean, description: New value for property enableSettings

setVisibleRowCount.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getVisibleRowCount visibleRowCount}. Number of visible rows of the table. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is 30.

parameters.iVisibleRowCount: type: int, description: New value for property visibleRowCount

getDecisionTableFormat.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getDecisionTableFormat decisionTableFormat}. The value determines whether the user can set the rendering of the decision Table to be based on cellFormat or rule Format Default value is RuleFormat.

getHitPolicies.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.120.2 to configure the settings, use the Manage Rules Project app or the Rule Authoring APIs.
Gets current value of property {@link #getHitPolicies hitPolicies}. The value determines how the results of the decision table are evaluated when more than one rule is matched for a given set of inputs. Default value is [FirstMatch, AllMatch].

sap.rules.ui.DecisionTableConfiguration.!description: The sap.rules.ui.DecisionTableConfiguration element provides the ability to define specific properties that will be applied when rendering the sap.rules.ui.RuleBuilder in decision table mode.

getMetadata.!description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.rules.ui.DecisionTableConfiguration.

getCellFormat.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.52.8 use the decisionTableFormat property.
Gets current value of property {@link #getCellFormat cellFormat}. The value determines the user input mode for the corresponding rule cells when creating or editing a rule. Default value is Both.

getEnableSettings.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.120.2 to configure the settings, use the Manage Rules Project app or the Rule Authoring APIs.
Gets current value of property {@link #getEnableSettings enableSettings}. The value determines whether the Settings button is displayed in a decision table when the control is used with S/4 HANA 17.05 (Cloud) or 17.09 (On Premise) and higher (On Premise). Default value is false.

getEnableSettingResult.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.120.2 to configure the settings, use the Manage Rules Project app or the Rule Authoring APIs.
Gets current value of property {@link #getEnableSettingResult enableSettingResult}. Default value is true.

attachChange.!description: Attaches event handler fnFunction to the {@link #event:change change} event of this sap.rules.ui.DecisionTableConfiguration. When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.rules.ui.DecisionTableConfiguration itself.
attachChange.!type: fn(oData?: Object, fnFunction: function(sap.ui.base.Event) : void, oListener?: Object) -> sap.rules.ui.DecisionTableConfiguration

parameters.oListener: type: object, description: Context object to call the event handler with. Defaults to this sap.rules.ui.DecisionTableConfiguration itself
parameters.fnFunction: type: function(sap.ui.base.Event) : void, description: The function to be called when the event occurs
parameters.oData: type: object, description: An application-specific payload object that will be passed to the event handler along with the event object when firing the event

fireChange.!description: Fires event {@link #event:change change} to attached listeners.

parameters.mParameters: type: object, description: Parameters to pass along with the event

extend.!description: Creates a new subclass of class sap.rules.ui.DecisionTableConfiguration with name sClassName and enriches it with the information contained in oClassInfo. oClassInfo might contain the same kind of information as described in {@link sap.ui.core.Element.extend}.
extend.!type: fn(sClassName: String, oClassInfo?: Object, FNMetaImpl?: fn()) -> fn()

parameters.oClassInfo: type: object, description: Object literal with information about the class
parameters.FNMetaImpl: type: function, description: Constructor function for the metadata object; if not given, it defaults to the metadata implementation used by this class
parameters.sClassName: type: string, description: Name of the class being created

sap.rules.ui.DecisionTableConfiguration.!helpDescription: The sap.rules.ui.DecisionTableConfiguration element provides the ability to define specific properties that will be applied when rendering the sap.rules.ui.RuleBuilder in decision table mode.

setHitPolicies.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.120.2 to configure the settings, use the Manage Rules Project app or the Rule Authoring APIs.
Sets a new value for property {@link #getHitPolicies hitPolicies}. The value determines how the results of the decision table are evaluated when more than one rule is matched for a given set of inputs. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is [FirstMatch, AllMatch].

parameters.sHitPolicies: type: sap.rules.ui.RuleHitPolicy[], description: New value for property hitPolicies

getThreshold.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getThreshold threshold}. The threshold defines how many additional (not yet visible records) shall be pre-fetched to enable smooth scrolling. The threshold is always added to the visibleRowCount. If the visibleRowCount is 10 and the threshold is 100, there will be 110 records fetched with the initial load. Default value is 30.

sap.rules.ui.ExpressionType.!description: An enumeration that defines the different business data types for an expression

All.!description: Specifies that the expression can be of any of the supported business data types.

TimeSpan.!description: Specifies that the expression must represent a time difference in milliseconds.

Number.!description: Specifies that the expression must represent a real number with or without dot-decimal notation.

Time.!description: Specifies that the expression must represent a time only.

String.!description: Specifies that the expression must represent a single-quoted UTF-8 encoded string.

Boolean.!description: Specifies that the expression must represent a Boolean data type: true, false.

Timestamp.!description: Specifies that the expression must represent a date and timestamp.

Date.!description: Specifies that the expression must represent a date only.
